questions.question: She is .......................  older than him.
questions.description: We can use much to modify comparatives.

questions.question: She is ........................... brilliant student in the class.
questions.description: We use the before the superlatives.

questions.question: The journey is as important ............................... the destination.
questions.description: To say that two things are equal or similar, we use the construction as....as...

questions.question: He is ............................... successful than me.
questions.description: More successful is the comparative term. We can use much to modify comparatives.

questions.question: It is more expensive ............................. I thought.
questions.description: Than is the conjunction used in comparative structures.

questions.question: She is ................................. woman I have ever seen.
I can't walk any .............................
questions.description: Both further and farther can be used to talk about distance.

questions.question: This fabric is inferior ................................. that fabric.
questions.description: After superior and inferior, we use 'to' not 'than'.

questions.question: Who is the ............................. of the two sisters?
questions.description: When a group has just two people, we use the comparative instead of the superlative.

questions.question: Your accent is ............................. than mine.
questions.description: Worse is the comparative form of bad.

questions.question: The car is running .............................. since it had a service.
questions.description: More smoothly is the comparative form of smoothly.

questions.question: She earns …………………………. than I do.
questions.description: Less is the comparative form of little.
